summary: This document is an email chain from September 2019 discussing a Netflix series about Jeffrey Epstein. A person is informing a colleague about a friend who is an executive producer on the series and is seeking an interview with someone from their office. The correspondence shows awareness of the Epstein case within media and legal circles shortly after his 2019 arrest.

persons.name: Unknown Sender
persons.context: The person who initiates the email chain, informing a colleague about a Netflix series on Epstein and seeking to arrange a discussion about a potential interview for the series.

persons.name: Unknown Recipient
persons.context: The colleague being contacted about the Netflix series. The sender plans to discuss the interview request with them first, suggesting they hold a position in a relevant office (likely legal or prosecutorial).

connections.description: Colleagues communicating about a media request related to the Epstein case. The sender defers to the recipient as the first point of contact.

events.title: Production of Netflix Epstein Series
events.description: A 4-part Netflix series on Jeffrey Epstein was in production, having been worked on for 18 months prior to Epstein's 2019 federal charges.

events.title: Epstein Charged by Federal Prosecutors
events.description: The email references that the Netflix producers had been working on the story for 18 months 'before we charged,' indicating the sender's office was involved in the federal prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: A 4-part Netflix documentary series about Jeffrey Epstein was in advanced production by September 2019.
The production team had been investigating the story for 18 months prior to Epstein's federal indictment in 2019.
The email correspondence shows media outreach to a prosecutorial or legal office involved in the Epstein case for an interview.
The communication indicates internal coordination ('press office and brass') within an office on how to handle media inquiries related to the high-profile case.
